The idiot below me has low attention span and deficient reading comprehension. I said "(don't play that shit scam)". I really don't, in fact, I get flamed all the time for criticizing these types of games who consists in nothing but farming the players wallets, in particular, those of fools who are either too gullible or too addicted due to some personal issues, people who are willing to prostitute themselves for it like it was a drug addiction (such as here in this manga). The same with smoking, always pointing out the boxes very own warning messages in regards to health. It pisses me off and I despise how much of a cancer it has become to the game industry, seeing how theydo the "get em' hooked on this shit early" aggressive strategy made me write all that.

- unchecked, in a way, the west has it just as bad, if not worse, due to foreign imported hypocrisy, so it's not just the gooks n cninks. Ever noticed how more and more, if not, every damn franchise with any string of notoriety has been turned into a "gachafest"? I blame the F/GO series, what used to be some typical japanosuke's wet dream fantasies about turning western historical figures into women and putting dick in it converted into a ruthless money-printing machine and with it, all the other japerverts were taken along for the ride, with that, the entire market, smelling the ¥€n$ and salivating on it, turned their franchises into a "gachafest" scheme, now every-fucking-body is doing it, and as corporates who already have an immoral amount of riches, get even more, the rest of the world becomes generally, poorer.

There is a serious concerning topic here worth discussing, and that is the gambling adiction "gacha" they are being peer-pressured with. Remember that south park episode? The canadian devil, with the "terrance & philips" mobile game? This is several times worst, one because they play it during school as phones are easily sneaked in. Two, it has been normalized to such degree that it seems to not even faze anyone upon hearing "I want a SSR gacha character" who I suppose (don't play that shit scam) that it either cost a lot of money, or a lot of time grinding whatever points system it uses. Three, it really is like smoking, "everyone is doing it! therefore I must too!" type of roping mentality that chains them from early age and doesn't wear off, how many have ruined themselves to this scheme? asians by default have an affinity for gambling adiction, it's in their blood, in the west, they remove the "gamecorner" from pkmn games, but leave all the other "surprise mechanic" tier games -
